title: Authors and Citation
text: Mizuki Uchida. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Uchida M (2022). navigatr: Navigation Menu Pipe-Friendly Data Processing. https://github.com/UchidaMizuki/navigatr, https://uchidamizuki.github.io/navigatr/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {navigatr: Navigation Menu for Pipe-Friendly Data Processing},   author = {Mizuki Uchida},   year = {2022},   note = {https://github.com/UchidaMizuki/navigatr, https://uchidamizuki.github.io/navigatr/}, }

what: Navigation Menu for Pipe-Friendly Data Processing
title: Navigation Menu for Pipe-Friendly Data Processing
text: navigatr provides navigation menu enable pipe-friendly data processing hierarchical data structures. activating menu items, can perform operations item maintaining overall structure attributes. three functions, new_menu(), activate() rekey(), core functions package. roles follows, new_menu() builds new navigation menu. activate() accesses menu item. rekey() renames key menu item.

title: Navigation Menu for Pipe-Friendly Data Processing
text: can install navigatr CRAN. can also install development version GitHub.

title: Navigation Menu for Pipe-Friendly Data Processing
text: build new navigation menu, give new_menu() unique keys list corresponding values. upper rows show menu items (keys left, value summaries right). defining pillar::obj_sum, can change way summaries displayed. can activate menu item activate(). Activating menu item allows perform operations active item. activate() turns navigatr_menu object navigatr_item object, deactivate() turns back. rekey() function used change key activated menu item. can also build nested navigation menu. activate items, specify multiple variables.
code: library(navigatr) library(dplyr) band <- new_menu(key = c("band_members", "band_instruments"),                  value = list(band_members, band_instruments)) band #> # ☐ band_members:     tibble [3 × 2] #> # ☐ band_instruments: tibble [3 × 2] #> #  #> # Please `activate()` an item. band <- band |>   activate(band_members) |>   filter(band == "Beatles") band #> # ☒ band_members:     tibble [2 × 2] #> # ☐ band_instruments: tibble [3 × 2] #> #  #> # A tibble: 2 × 2 #>   name  band    #>   <chr> <chr>   #> 1 John  Beatles #> 2 Paul  Beatles band <- band |>    deactivate() band #> # ☐ band_members:     tibble [2 × 2] #> # ☐ band_instruments: tibble [3 × 2] #> #  #> # Please `activate()` an item. band |>    activate(band_instruments) |>    rekey("new_band_instruments") #> # ☐ band_members:         tibble [2 × 2] #> # ☒ new_band_instruments: tibble [3 × 2] #> #  #> # A tibble: 3 × 2 #>   name  plays  #> * <chr> <chr>  #> 1 John  guitar #> 2 Paul  bass   #> 3 Keith guitar bands <- new_menu(key = c("key1", "key2"),                   value = list(band, band)) # A list of menu objects bands |>    activate(key1, band_instruments) |>    select(name) #> # ☒ key1: menu [2] #> #   ☐ band_members:     tibble [2 × 2] #> #   ☒ band_instruments: tibble [3 × 1] #> # ☐ key2: menu [2] #> #  #> # A tibble: 3 × 1 #>   name  #> * <chr> #> 1 John  #> 2 Paul  #> 3 Keith

title: Activate/deactivate a menu item — activate
text: Activates menu item syntax dplyr::pull(). Activating menu item allows perform operations active item. activate() turns navigatr_nav object navigatr_item object, deactivate() turns back.

title: Activate/deactivate a menu item — activate
code: activate(.data, ..., .add = FALSE)  # S3 method for navigatr_nav activate(.data, ..., .add = FALSE)  # S3 method for navigatr_item activate(.data, ..., .add = FALSE)  deactivate(x, ..., deep = TRUE)  # S3 method for navigatr_nav deactivate(x, ..., deep = TRUE)  # S3 method for navigatr_item deactivate(x, ..., deep = TRUE)

title: Activate/deactivate a menu item — activate
text: .data navigatr_nav object. ... activate(), one variables passed dplyr::pull(). deactivate(), unused (extensibility). .add Whether add new variables path indices. FALSE (default value), menu deactivated first deactivate(). x navigatr_nav object. deep TRUE (default value), deactivate recursively.

title: Activate/deactivate a menu item — activate
text: activate(), navigatr_item object. inherits class navigatr_nav, menu displayed hierarchically. Otherwise, active data displayed. deactivate(), navigatr_nav object.

title: Activate/deactivate a menu item — activate
code: library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union  mn1 <- new_menu(key = c("band_members", "band_instruments"),                 value = list(band_members, band_instruments))  mn1 %>%   activate(band_members) %>%   filter(band == "Beatles") #> # ☒ band_members:     item [2 × 2] #> # ☐ band_instruments: item [3 × 2] #> #  #> # A tibble: 2 × 2 #>   name  band    #>   <chr> <chr>   #> 1 John  Beatles #> 2 Paul  Beatles  # Items can also be specified as integers mn1 %>%   activate(2) #> # ☐ band_members:     item [3 × 2] #> # ☒ band_instruments: item [3 × 2] #> #  #> # A tibble: 3 × 2 #>   name  plays  #> * <chr> <chr>  #> 1 John  guitar #> 2 Paul  bass   #> 3 Keith guitar  mn1 %>%   activate(-1) %>%   deactivate() #> # ☐ band_members:     item [3 × 2] #> # ☐ band_instruments: item [3 × 2] #> #  #> # Please `activate()`.  # To activate items in a nested menu, specify multiple variables mn2 <- new_menu(key = c("key1", "key2"),                 value = list(mn1, mn1)) mn2 %>%   activate(key1, band_members) #> # ☒ key1: item [2] #> #   ☒ band_members:     item [3 × 2] #> #   ☐ band_instruments: item [3 × 2] #> # ☐ key2: item [2] #> #  #> # A tibble: 3 × 2 #>   name  band    #> * <chr> <chr>   #> 1 Mick  Stones  #> 2 John  Beatles #> 3 Paul  Beatles

title: Update items — itemise
text: Update items

title: Update items — itemise
code: itemise(.data, ...)  itemize(.data, ...)  # S3 method for navigatr_nav itemise(.data, ...)  # S3 method for navigatr_item itemise(.data, ...)

title: Update items — itemise
text: .data navigatr_nav navigatr_item object. ... navigatr_nav objects, use key_name = item_value. navigatr_item objects, new item value.

title: Update items — itemise
text: navigatr_nav navigatr_item object.

what: Build a new navigation menu — new_menu
title: Build a new navigation menu — new_menu
text: build new navigation menu, give new_menu() unique keys list corresponding values. top row shows menu items (keys left, value summaries right). summaries pillar::obj_sum outputs, can change printing methods. menu item can accessed activate().

title: Build a new navigation menu — new_menu
code: new_menu(   key = character(),   value = list(),   attrs = NULL,   ...,   class = character() )

title: Build a new navigation menu — new_menu
text: key unique character vector. key character vector, converted character vector .character(). value list values corresponding keys. value list, converted list .list(). attrs data frame additional attributes items (empty data frame default). item becomes active, attrs added attributes. ... Additional arguments passed vctrs::new_data_frame(). class character vector subclasses passed vctrs::new_data_frame().

title: Build a new navigation menu — new_menu
text: navigatr_nav_menu object, subclass class data.frame.

title: Build a new navigation menu — new_menu
code: library(dplyr)  band <- new_menu(key = c("band_members", "band_instruments"),                  value = list(band_members, band_instruments)) band #> # ☐ band_members:     item [3 × 2] #> # ☐ band_instruments: item [3 × 2] #> #  #> # Please `activate()`.  # You can also build a nested menu bands <- new_menu(key = c("key1", "key2"),                   value = list(band, band)) bands #> # ☐ key1: item [2] #> # ☐ key2: item [2] #> #  #> # Please `activate()`.

title: Rename key names — rekey
text: Rename key names

title: Rename key names — rekey
code: rekey(.data, ...)  # S3 method for navigatr_nav rekey(.data, ...)  # S3 method for navigatr_item rekey(.data, ...)  rekey_with(.data, .fn, .keys = dplyr::everything(), ...)

title: Rename key names — rekey
text: .data rekey(), navigatr_nav navigatr_item object. rekey_with(), navigatr_nav object. ... navigatr_nav objects, use new_name = old_name. navigatr_item objects, scalar character new key name. .fn function used transform selected .keys. .keys Keys rename; defaults keys.

title: Rename key names — rekey
text: navigatr_nav navigatr_item object.

title: navigatr 0.1.2
text: CRAN release: 2022-05-14 Add itemise() update menu items. Change rekey() generic function. Change size summaries menus pillar::size_sum.navigatr_menu(). Update README.

title: navigatr 0.1.1
text: CRAN release: 2022-02-21 Adds rekey() rename key menu item. Fix bug menu attributes changed properly. Fix bug occurs menus values tibble.

title: navigatr 0.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2022-01-26 first release.
